meanings.definition: To pull or tear away forcibly.
meanings.sent1: She was avulsing the weeds from the garden.
meanings.sent2: The dentist was avulsing the decayed tooth.
meanings.sent3: The toddler thought avulsing the wrapping paper off the gift was a fun game.
meanings.sent4: The storm was avulsing the leaves from the trees, creating a colorful carpet on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The chef was avulsing the skin from the potato with precision.

meanings.definition: The act of forcibly tearing away.
meanings.sent1: The avulsing of the poster from the wall left a mark.
meanings.sent2: The avulsing of the bandage caused a slight discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The avulsing of the ticket from the machine made a satisfying sound.
meanings.sent4: The avulsing of the page from the notebook symbolized a fresh start.
meanings.sent5: The avulsing of the flower from the bouquet revealed a hidden note.
